required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Apatinib Tablets in the Treatment of Advanced or Metastatic Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Apatinib in Patients With Advanced Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma After Failure of Two or More Lines of Chemotherapy (Ahead-G201): a Prospective, Single-arm, Multicenter, Phase IV Study

brief_summary.textblock: The large-scale phase IV study aims to verify the safety and efficacy of apatinib in patients with advanced gastric cancer or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma after failure of two lines of chemotherapy. Apatinib initiated at a recommended dose of 850mg. However, the starting dose was decided by investigator's choice based on patients' condition. Dose interruption and dose reduction were allowed according to the product label. Treatment continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, withdrawal of informed consent, or at investigators' discretion. The primary endpoint was safety, which was assessed by recording the incidence and severity of adverse events.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A large-scale single-arm phase IV study

primary_outcome.measure: Safety, which was assessed by recording the incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: between first dose of apatinib and up to 30 days after the last dose of apatinib

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Event driven, an expected average of 34 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life, measured by the questionnaire of EORTC QLQ-C30
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Quality of life will be assessed at baseline (after the patients provided written informed consent) until at least 4 weeks after the last dose of study drug was administered, an expected average of 14 weeks

clinical_study.condition: Advanced Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma
